result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer D. Rieth

defendant.name: Rieth, Jennifer D.
defendant.address: 332 Second Street N, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Anne Renc and dated 03/23/17 in re:   representation of the defendant has been terminated

Attorney Anne Renc in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:13 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Court reviews the file.
Notice was returned to sender, unable to forward.

Atty Renc addresses the Court, has no information. Atty Renc's letter that she sent to Defendant was returned as well.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders Bench Warrant, body only.

Not Deliveralble As Addressed 
12/2/14 plea hearing
Plea hearing on December 2, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *Kmart Store in Stevens Point WI, not on their premises*
8/11/14 Amended from $200 cash bond to $200 signature bond. Conditions remain the same.

Defendant Jennifer D. Rieth in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Jennifer D. Rieth in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

Bond Continued.

Atty Renc indicates there is a stipulation to amend the bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jennifer D. Rieth
Current: 332 Second Street N, Stevens Point, WI 54481   (Effective: 08-11-2014)
Prior: Salvation Army, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jennifer D. Rieth appeared by video.  Attorney Anne Renc in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *Kmart Store in Stevens Point WI, not on their premises*

ADA  Knaapen appears in Court.  
Intern Taylor Kraus also appears
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:32 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Intern Kraus states facts for anticipated charges of Retail Theft.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Defendant has been seen by someone from the public defender's office this morning, is not sure if a lawyer will be appointed. 
Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant is from Milwaukee, uses general delivery at the post office. Defendant has friends, who she couch hops. Mercy Woods is Defendant's friend. 
Defendant is not employed at this time.
State requests a $250 cash bond  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: July 28, 2014   @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
